revised_title: The Influence of Acids on the Rotatory Power of Cane Sugar, Glucose, and Fructose
tldr: This study investigates the effect of acids, specifically benzenesulfonic acid, on the rotatory power of cane sugar, glucose, and fructose. The results show that as the concentration of the acid increases, the rotatory power of the sugars also increases, suggesting that acids play a significant role in altering the optical properties of these sugars.
